conclusion: Liquid flows from inlets A, B, C, and D and needs to be traced through baffles to determine final container.
Liquid from A hits the upper blue baffle angled downwards from left to right.
Liquid from A flows to the right end of the blue baffle and falls vertically.
Falling liquid from A lands on the brown baffle angled downwards from left to right.
Liquid from A flows to the right end of the brown baffle and falls vertically.
Falling liquid from A lands on the black baffle angled downwards from left to right.
Liquid from A flows to the right end of the black baffle and falls vertically into a container.
Liquid from B hits the upper yellow baffle, part of the same baffle as the blue one.
Liquid from B follows the same path as A through the brown and black baffles.
Liquid from C hits the upper green baffle, also part of the same baffle.
Liquid from C follows the same path as A and B through the brown and black baffles.
Liquid from D hits the grey baffle angled downwards from right to left.
Liquid from D flows to the left end of the grey baffle and falls vertically.
Falling liquid from D lands on the black baffle angled downwards from left to right.
Liquid from D flows to the right end of the black baffle and falls vertically into a container.
Right end of the black baffle is positioned above container G.
All liquid flowing off the right end of the black baffle falls into container G.
All paths from A, B, C, and D lead to container G.
The final answer is container G.
